intro: Jacquemontia palmeri, commonly known as Palmer's morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family, which includes many species of morning glories. The plant is characterized by its trumpet-shaped, pale yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the morning. Its leaves are heart-shaped and often have a velvety texture. Jacquemontia palmeri is typically found in arid or semi-arid environments, growing in rocky soils and along dry streambeds.
